result.execSummary:
All charges against Darren Marcus Hewison in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Darren Marcus Hewison is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darren Marcus Hewison

records.addlTxt:
3:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Darren Marcus Hewison appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appeared by video for Darren Marcus Hewison. Calling 22CF64, 22CF62, 22CM18, 22CM25, 22CM68, 22CF11 & 22FO129. 22CM68 set for a Adjourned Initial Appearance. 22CF62 & 22CF64 set for a Competence Hearing. Court has reviewed competency report. Burns has reviewed with Defendant - Defendant is competent to proceed - Medication has been adjusted - Not challanging report. Court finds Defendant is competent to proceed. Burns in receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Court will set out for preliminary hearing in 3 of the cases. Burns has received offer - will review with Defendant. Burns/Schiek statement to bond. Court will modify bond in 22CF62 & 22CF64 adj. 03:38 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Darren Marcus Hewison appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appeared by video for Darren Marcus Hewison. Calling 22CF64, 22CM68, 22CF62, 22CF11, 22CM25, 22CM18, 22FO129. Victim appears by phone in 22CM68. Court statement - notes competency report has not been completed. Facility requests extension. Burns makes request for bond reduction to signature bond w/condition that he be released if bed available in dual diagnosis facility. Hewison statement. Court needs further information and will entertain request after more information provided. Sowinski statement. Adj. 11:15 a.m.
Competency hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm. in 22CF11, 22CF62, 22CF64

records.addlTxt:
3:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Darren Marcus Hewison appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appeared by video for Darren Marcus Hewison. Calling 22CF11, 22CM18 & 22CM25. Information has been filed in 22CF11 - not guilty plea. Burns/Pfeifer statement to bond. Bail continued. adj. 03:40 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Darren Marcus Hewison appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appeared by video for Darren Marcus Hewison. 
Calling 20cf22 for prelim - 22cm18 and 22cm25 for status.
State calls Officer Ryan Larson/sworn/Direct - Witness IDs defendant.  Cross by Burns. Re direct by Pfeiffer. Re Cross by Burns.
Court statement. Court finds probable cause exists at this time and binds over. Burns willing to proceed to arraignment -  Pfeifer request separate arraignment date.
Burns to bail - Pfeifer statement - Defendant statement- Court statement -continues bail as set.  Court may revisit at arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Darren Marcus Hewison appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF11, 22CM18 & 22CM25. 22CM18 & 22CM25 set for an initial appearance. 22CF11 set for an adjourned initial appearance. Court states PD's office is still searching for counsel - Courts office reaching out to local counsel. In receipt of complaint in 22CM25 to be provided complaint in 22CM25, right to counsel. Defendant/Schiek statement to bond. Court sets bond signature bond in 22CM18 & 22CM25 and continues bond in 22CF11. adj. 11:24 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
